post.title: Start page
post.content:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

post.title: History
post.content:
The name of the Academy was officially introduced by the Law of November 1, 1886, but it was not the actual beginning of the Academy's work in Serbia. The formal founding of the Serbian Royal Academy was only one of the turning points in the development of learned societies in Serbia. The Academy inherited the property of the Serbian Learned Society and continued its work. Finally, in 1892 when the two institutions merged the Academy accepted the members of the Serbian Learned Society as its own either regular or honorary members. The Serbian Learned Society (1864-1892) was, however, only the short-term extension of the suspended Society of Serbian Letters (1841-1864). Thus, the development of the Serbian Academy of Sciences and Arts cannot be presented without the learned societies that preceded it and from which it originated. ENDOWMENTS and FUNDS have also enormous importance for life and development of the Academy.
Presidents:
  • Josif Pančić (1887-1888)
  • Čedomilj Mijatović (1888-1889)
  • Dimitrije Nešić (1892-1895)
  • Milan Đ. Milićević (1896-1899)
  • Jovan Ristić (1899)
  • Sima Lozanić (1899-1900)
  • Jovan Mišković (1900-1903)
  • Sima Lozanić (1903-1906)
  • Stojan Novaković (1906-1915)
  • Jovan Žujović (1915-1921)
  • Jovan Cvijić (1921-1827)
  • Slobodan Jovanović (1928-1931)
  • Bogdan Gavrilović (1931-1937)
  • Aleksandar Belić (1937-1960)
  • Ilija Đuričić (1960-1965)
  • Velibor Gligorić (1965-1971)
  • Pavle Savić (1971-1981)
  • Dušan Kanazir (1981-1994)
  • Aleksandar Despić (1994-1998)
  • Dejan Medaković (1999-2003)
  • Nikola Hajdin (2003-2015)
  • Vladimir Kostić (2015
More detailed information on the Academy members may be obtained in the SASA Library.

post.title: Josif Pančić
post.content:
(Bribir, April 5/17 1814 - Belgrade, February 25/March 8 1888) physician and botanist Society of Serbian Letters (SSL): corresponding member from January 8 1850. Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Department for Natural Sciences and Mathematics) elected July 29 1864 – President SLS 1879–1882. – Secretary of the Department for Natural Sciences and Mathematics of SLS 1864–1866.

Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Full member (Academy of Natural Sciences) elected April 5 1887. – President of SRA from April 5 1887 until February 25 1888.

post.title: Čedomilj MIJATOVIĆ
post.content: (Belgrade, October 5/17 1842 - London, May 14 1932) historian, politician and economist Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Department for Social and Historical Sciences) from January 8 1867. Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Full member (Academy of Social Sciences) elected April 5 1887. Secretary of the Academy of Social Sciences of SRA from May 27 1887 until April 2 1889. President of SRA from February 6 1888 until December 24 1888 [representative] from December 24 1888 until October 18 1889.

post.title: Dimitrije Nešić
post.content: (Belgrade, October 8/20 1836 - Belgrade, April 26/May 9 1904) mathematician Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Department for Natural Sciences and Mathematics) from January 25 1870 and (Committee for Promotion of Science and Literature among People) from 1883. Secretary of the Committee for Natural Sciences and Mathematics SLS 1877–1878. Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Full member (Academy of Natural Sciences) from April 5 1887. President of SRA from November 18 1892 until November 18 1895. Secretary of the Academy of Natural Sciences of SRA from May 27 1887 until February 22 1892 and from February 22 1900 until February 22 1902.

post.title: Milan Đ. Milićević
post.content: (Ripanj, June 4 1831 - Belgrade, November 4/17 1908) writer, politician and ethnographer Society of Serbian Letters (SSL): Full member from January 13 1857. Treasurer of SSL 1859 -1860. Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Department for Social and Historical Sciences) elected July 29 1864 and (Department for Philosophical and Philological Sciences). Secretary of the Department for Philosophical and Philological Sciences of SLS 1874-1875; Secretary of the Committee for Philosophical and Philological Sciences of SLS 1881-1882. Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Full member (Academy of Social Sciences) elected April 5 1887. Secretary of the Academy of Social Sciences of SRA from April 2 1889 until February 22 1890. Interim Secretary of SRA (Representative of the Permanent Secretary) from March 13 1889 until September 4 1895. President of SRA from January 1(3) 1896 until January 1(18) 1899.

post.title: Jovan Ristić
post.content: (Kragujevac, January 4 1831 - Belgrade, August 23/September 4 1899) statesman and historian Society of Serbian Letters (SSL): Full member from January 2 1855. Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Department for Social and Historical Sciences) from September 11 1864. Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Full member (Academy of Social Sciences) from January 6 1890. President of SRA from January 11(18) until August 23 1899.

post.title: Sima Lozanić
post.content: (Belgrade, February 24/March 8 1847 - Belgrade, July 7 1935) chemist and politician Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Department for Natural Sciences and Mathematics) from January 30 1873 and (Committee for Promotion of Science and Literature among People) from 1883. Secretary of the Board of SLS 1886–1889. Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Correspondent (Academy of Natural Sciences) from January 23 1888. Full member (Academy of Natural Sciences) from January 6 1890. Secretary of the Academy of Natural Sciences of SRA from February 22 1896 until February 22 1898; from February 22 1914 until March 7 1923. President of SRA from September 1 1899 until March 2(13) 1900; from February 1 1903 until February 1 1906.

post.title: Јоvan Mišković
post.content: (Negotin, July 6/18 1844 - Belgrade, October 20/November 2 1908) officer and military writer Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Department for Natural Sciences and Mathematics) from June 2 1875. Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Full member (Academy of Social Sciences) from December 28 1892. President of SRA from April 16 1900 until February 1 1903 [out of office: December 2 1902 – February 1 1903]. Secretary of the Academy of Social Sciences SRA from February 22 1906 until February 22 1908.

post.title: Stojan Novaković
post.content: (Šabac, November 1 1842 - Niš, February 5 1915) philologist, historian and politician Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Department for Philosophical and Philological Sciences) from November 14 1865. – Secretary and Treasurer from 1867 until 1873. Secretary of the Committee for Philosophical and Philological Sciences from 1878 until 1880. Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Full member (Academy of Philosophical Sciences) elected April 5 1887. – Secretary of the Academy of Philosophical Sciences from February 22 1892 until February 22 1896. President of the Academy from February 1 1906 until February 4 1915.

post.title: Jovan Žujović
post.content: (Brusnica, October 18 1856 - Belgrade, July 19 1936) geologist and politician Serbian Learned Society (SLS): Full member (Committee for Natural Sciences and Mathematics) from January 30 1883. Secretary of the Committee for Natural Sciences and Mathematics 1890–1891. Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Full member (Academy of Natural Sciences) elected April 5 1887. President of SRA: April 2 1915 – October 31 1918; October 31 1918 – March 7 1921. Interim Secretary of SRA: April 28 1887 – March 13 1889; September 4 1895 – December 28 1905. Secretary of the Academy of Natural Sciences from February 22 1895 until February 22 1896; from February 22 1906 until February 22 1911; from March 7 1923 until March 6 1928. Full member (Committee for Natural Sciences and Mathematics) from January 30 1883. Secretary of the Committee for Natural Sciences and Mathematics 1890–1891.

post.title: Jovan Cvijić
post.content: (Loznica, September 29 1865 - Belgrade, January 16 1927) geographer, аntropogeographer, ethnographer Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Correspondent (Academy of Social Sciences) from February 5 1896. Full member (Academy of Social Sciences) from February 4 1899. Secretary of the Academy of Natural Sciences of SRA from February 22 1904 until February 22 1905; from February 22 1911 until February 22 1912. President of the Academy from April 12(18) 1921 until March 7(31) 1924; from March 13(31) 1924 until January 16 1927.

post.title: Sample Page
post.content:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

post.title: Fondovi i zadužbine
post.content: SEKULE ZEČEVIĆ FUND DJORDJE ZEČEVIĆ FUND FOR THE PROMOTION AND PROTECTION OF THE CYRILLIC SCRIPT NIKOLA TRAJKOVIĆ FUND VELIBOR AND ZORA POPOVIĆ FUND FUND OF BRANISLAV BRANE BELIĆ, PROFESSOR OF ENGLISH LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE FROM BELGRADE DJORDJE LAZAREVIĆ FUND IVAN TABAKOVIĆ FUND DRAGOSLAV SREJOVIĆ FOUNDATION FOR CAPITAL RESEARCH AND ART PROJECTS OF THE ACADEMY BRANKO ĆOPIĆ ENDOWMENT FOUNDATION FOR STUDIES OF SCIENCE AND ART RAJKO AND MAY DJERMANOVIĆ FUND

post.title: Funds, Endowments and Foundations of the Serbian Academy of Sciences and Arts
post.content: SEKULE ZEČEVIĆ FUND DJORDJE ZEČEVIĆ FUND FOR THE PROMOTION AND PROTECTION OF THE CYRILLIC SCRIPT NIKOLA TRAJKOVIĆ FUND VELIBOR AND ZORA POPOVIĆ FUND FUND OF BRANISLAV BRANE BELIĆ, PROFESSOR OF ENGLISH LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE FROM BELGRADE DJORDJE LAZAREVIĆ FUND IVAN TABAKOVIĆ FUND DRAGOSLAV SREJOVIĆ FOUNDATION FOR CAPITAL RESEARCH AND ART PROJECTS OF THE ACADEMY BRANKO ĆOPIĆ ENDOWMENT FOUNDATION FOR STUDIES OF SCIENCE AND ART RAJKO AND MAY DJERMANOVIĆ FUND

post.title: Slobodan Jovanović
post.content: (Novi Sad, November 21/December 3 1869 - London, December 12 1958) lawyer, historian, politician and writer Sebian Royal Academy (SRA): Correspondent (Academy of Social Sciences) from February 4 1905. Full member (Academy of Social Sciences) from February 4 1908. President of SRA from January 31 1928 until January 31 1931. Secretary of the Academy of Social Sciences of SRA from February 22 1914 until March 7 1925. Serbian Academy of Sciences (SAS): Full member from March 22 1948.
